clinical_study.brief_title: The Prognostic and Diagnostic Value of Ferritin in Critically Ill Patients With Special Focus on Underlying Hemophagocytic Lymphohistiocytosis
clinical_study.official_title: The Prognostic and Diagnostic Value of Ferritin in Critically Ill Patients With Special Focus on Underlying Hemophagocytic Lymphohistiocytosis

brief_summary.textblock: Retrospective analysis of ferritin, outcome and HLH-criteria in critically ill patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is a retrospective register study of critically ill patients from Charité - University Medicine Berlin during 2000 and 2016 that had at least one measurement of plasma ferritin. Outcome, underlying diagnoses and HLH-2004 criteria (Henter JI et al. 2007) will be analysed and the HScore of these patients will be calculated (Fardet L et al. 2014). All recorded data of the specific admission term in ICU will be used for the analysis. No follow-up of the patients after discharge will be performed in this study. The study does not involve any randomization or any drug testing.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed up for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of two months
primary_outcome.description: A retrospective analysis of patients with available charts to determine the outcome whether patients survived the ICU or died.

primary_outcome.measure: Probability of having undiagnosed Hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (HLH)
primary_outcome.time_frame: The participants will be followed up for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of two months
primary_outcome.description: Retrospective analysis of available charts, underlying diagnoses, findings and blood values: HLH-2004 criteria (Henter JI et al. 2007) and HScore (Fardet L et al. 2014)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed up for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of two months
secondary_outcome.description: Retrospective analysis of available charts and underlying diagnoses

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed up for the duration of intensive care unit stay, an expected average of one week
